children.name:
`cy.visit()` failed trying to load:

http://localhost:3000/

We attempted to make an http request to this URL but the request failed without a response.

We received this error at the network level:

  > Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:3000

Common situations why this would fail:
  - you don't have internet access
  - you forgot to run / boot your web server
  - your web server isn't accessible
  - you have weird network configuration settings on your computer
Check Host elements exist on the page

`cy.visit()` failed trying to load:

http://localhost:3002/

We attempted to make an http request to this URL but the request failed without a response.

We received this error at the network level:

  > Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:3002

Common situations why this would fail:
  - you don't have internet access
  - you forgot to run / boot your web server
  - your web server isn't accessible
  - you have weird network configuration settings on your computer
Check Remote elements exist on the page

The following error originated from your application code, not from Cypress. It was caused by an unhandled promise rejection.

  > Loading script failed.
(error: http://localhost:3004/remoteEntry.js)
while loading "./loadApp" from webpack/container/reference/app_04

When Cypress detects uncaught errors originating from your application it will automatically fail the current test.

This behavior is configurable, and you can choose to turn this off by listening to the `uncaught:exception` event.

https://on.cypress.io/uncaught-exception-from-application
Check App build and running & Check app elements exist

`cy.visit()` failed trying to load:

http://localhost:3002//shop

The response we received from your web server was:

  > 500: Internal Server Error

This was considered a failure because the status code was not `2xx`.

This http request was redirected '1' time to:

  - 308: http://localhost:3002/shop

If you do not want status codes to cause failures pass the option: `failOnStatusCode: false`
Check the header content of Shop page
Timed out retrying after 10000ms: Expected to find element: `h1`, but never found it.

The following error originated from your application code, not from Cypress.

  > Additional keys were returned from `getServerSideProps`. Properties intended for your component must be nested under the `props` key, e.g.:

	return { props: { title: 'My Title', content: '...' } }

Keys that need to be moved: userId, id, title, completed.
Read more: https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/invalid-getserversideprops-value

When Cypress detects uncaught errors originating from your application it will automatically fail the current test.

This behavior is configurable, and you can choose to turn this off by listening to the `uncaught:exception` event.

https://on.cypress.io/uncaught-exception-from-application
Check that Shop navigation link works
Check that Shop text navigation link works
